alert.note: Alert for Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 12:17PM AKST until March 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY STARTING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... A rapidly strengthening low will develop in the Gulf of Alaska during the day on Tuesday. This low is expected to move towards the northern gulf coast before stalling out during the day on Wednesday. Snow will begin in the Yakutat area before extending to the south during the overnight hours of Tuesday night into the day on Wednesday. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow may cause a mix with or complete change to rain Wednesday afternoon and evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Prince of Wales Island. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to mix with or change to rain Wednesday morning. Highest snow accumulations will be on the higher elevations of the road system.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
